description: Use of premises as a nursery for 20 children (0-5 years) (D1)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | This permission shall be for a limited period expiring on 29 February 2008 when the use hereby permitted shall be discontinued.  Reason: In order to assess the impact of the development over a period of time in the interests of protecting living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004). | No more than 20 children, between the ages of 0-5 years, shall be on the register of the school or shall attend the nursery school hereby permitted at any one time, and no more than 8 staff shall be employed at the nursery.   Reason: To prevent over intensification of the use of the site and in the interests of safeguarding amenity of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, the premises shall only be used as a day nursery for children between the ages of 0-5 years only and not for any other use without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.   Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004). | The external area of the site shall not be used as a play space for the children, or for formal congregation or gatherings of any kind. All activities associated with the use, except the collection and dropping off of children, shall be undertaken within the building.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004). | The use permitted shall not operate outside 08:00hrs and 18:30hrs Monday to Friday and shall not operate at any time on Saturday, Sunday and Public or Bank Holidays. The building shall not be used for any other purposes whatsoever.  Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004). | The yard area of the site shall not be used for parking, or by vehicles collecting or dropping off children.   Reason: To restrict vehicular movements to the site and to protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004). | Details of soundproofing, sound insulation and noise mitigation measures shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before commencement of the day nursery use hereby permitted. The approved insulation measures shall be implemented before initial occupation of the use and retained permanently thereafter.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (2004). | Details of measures to ensure staggered drop-off and collection times for children are implemented shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the nursery use. The approved drop off/collection proposals, and the measures approved in the Travel Plan received by the Local Planning Authority on 15/12/05, shall be implemented prior to the day nursery use hereby permitted commencing or in accordance with a programme set out in the Travel Plan, and shall be so maintained for the duration of the use, unless the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority is obtained to any variation.  Reason: To accord with the terms of the application and to restrain vehicular movements in the vicinity of the site in the interests of highway safety, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for Environment' (12/10/04). | Details of measures to ensure access for all, including a level entrance and accessible toilet facilities, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the day nursery use commencing. The proposal shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to the commencement of the use and shall thereafter be permanently maintained.  Reason: To ensure appropriate accessibility for people with disabilities in accordance with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding any indications on the submitted drawings, details of the cycle parking and buggy/pram parking shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the day nursery use. The cycle and buggy/pram parking facilities shall be provided in accordance with the approved details prior to the commencement of the use and shall be thereafter be permanently so maintained.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate cycle and buggy/pram parking available within the site, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
